a public advocate against cult activities
a woman with strong opinions lobbying against such issues as comparable-worth legislation

Lifespring , a self-help course that challenges students to take responsibility for students lives A small percentage of the program 's 300,000 graduates have been deeply disturbed by Lifespring 's methods , which involve intense emotional self-examination
Clarence Thomas that was used as grounds for Dean Kelley organization 's opposition to the Supreme Court nominee
the same standard , some blacks who see the marriage as evidence that Clarence Thomas has rejected his roots

chairman of Howard University 's department of Afro-American studies '' Great justices have had community roots that served as a basis for understanding the Constitution Clarence 's lack of a sense of community makes Clarence nomination troubling

a Chicago-based organization that says her former involvement educates the public about '' destructive '' cults That involvement , The author said , might affect Virginia Thomas in his text husband 's handling of religious-liberty cases if The author shares Virginia Thomas in his text views on the subject
